results.title: Bugs Bunny's 1001 rabbit tales
results.creator_credit: Isadore Freleng and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Compilation of classic Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes cartoons featuring Bugs and Daffy going on the road as two travelling salesmen for Rambling House Publishing Co. Sultan Yosemite Sam is their number one client, and Sam’s royal heir, the Crown Prince of Abadaba, demands constant storytelling, or tantrums ensue. Bugs is held captive reading aloud from the book he is selling. So Bugs retells several children’s classics in his own irreverent style. Voice characterisations by Mel Blanc.

results.title: Budgeting (NP)
results.brief_description: Shows the essentials of business budgeting, explains how to construct a budget and why it is such an important management tool. Provides clear and colourful graphics with animated sequences. Features John Cleese. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Buddhism: The Path to Enlightenment
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the Buddha from his birth as a prince through time spent as a wandering mendicant in search of a solution for life’s sorrow to his later years when he trudged the dusty paths of India preaching his ego-shattering life-redeeming message. That message is threaded throughout the film as we visit monasteries and families in two different craft communities and see how Buddhism has influenced the lives of these gentle people in southeast Asia.

results.title: Islam
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
Like Christianity, Islam is winning converts, particularly in North Africa. This film explores the faith of the Muslims, taking you to Mecca, birthplace of the Prophet Mohamed, and to the shrine of Islam’s holy of holies, the Ka’aba, or Cube. Following the routes of Muslim conquest, you see shrines of holy men and heroes from Cairo to Pakistan. Wherever you go in this vast empire, the power of Islam is apparent in soaring domes and noble architecture of great cities. Against this background the film relates the history of Mohamed and his rise to leadership, spiritual and temporal. Narrated by Douglas Rain.

results.title: Hinduism
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
In India, the home of most present adherents, this film traces the history of Hinduism, its evolution over the centuries and its connections to Buddhism and Jainism. Shown are the observances of this faith, its teaching of non-violence, its respect for all living things, how the social order created by it has been modified in the modern world to outlaw the declaration of individuals as “untouchables” and to remove limitations on freedom imposed by caste.

results.title: Buck Rogers. Vol. 5
results.creator_credit: Dick Lowry, Phil Leacock, David J. O'Connell, Jock Gaynor and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buck Rogers in the 25th century”.
In ‘Unchained woman’, The Earth Defense Directorate send Buck and Wilma on a mission to rescue Jen Burton, the partner of notorious shipping pirate Malary Pantera, from a state-of-the-art underground jail where she has been incarcerated for a murder that Pantera actually committed. Masquerading as a convict, Buck infiltrates the high-tech facility, detonates a bomb, and they break out, heading to a nearby spaceport to meet Wilma and return to Earth. However, an android prison guard damaged during the explosion begins a relentless pursuit of them, determined to uphold the law. Their situation is complicated further when a traitorous ambassador informs Malary of Jen’s escape and the Earth Directorate’s plans to use her to gain information that will ultimately lead to his arrest. It is up to Buck and Wilma to both defeat him and shut down the obsessed android before Jen is silenced forever. In ‘Planet of the Amazon women’, Buck is lured to the planet Zantia after answering a distress call from two women whose space yacht is malfunctioning. Once on the planet’s surface, he learns that there is a shortage of men on Zantia, and that he is to be sold off to the highest bidder at an auction. Purchased by the Prime Minister’s daughter Ariela, he is surprised when he discovers what her true intentions are. With Wilma leaving delicate trade negotiations to go in search of her missing friend, it is up to Buck and Ariela to overthrow her mother’s oppressive government and liberate the planet’s male population from their captors before they declare another war on Zantia. Stars Gil Gerard as Buck, Erin Gray as Col. Deering, and Tim O’Connor as Dr. Huer. Special guest Jamie Lee Curtis stars as Jen Burton in ‘Unchained woman’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dick Lowry, Phil Leacock, David J. O’Connell, Jock Gaynor and Universal Pictures

results.title: Bud and Lou
results.creator_credit: Robert C Thompson, Clyde B Phillips and Bob Balaban
results.brief_description: This is a biographical made for television feature length film based on the book “Bud & Lou” by Bob Thomas which attempts to portray both the personal and professional lives of the comedic partnership of Bud Abbott and Lou Costello. It follows their career from the Burlesque days, through to broadway, radio, Hollywood and eventually television, entertaining millions along the way. They were renowned for their generosity to charitable causes and were heavily involved with the War Bond drives during WWII but each had their own personal demons to deal with including Lou’s problem with gambling and Bud’s problems with drinking and epilepsy. Harvey Korman stars as Bud Abbott, Buddy Hackett as Lou Costello, and Arte Johnson plays their loyal agent Eddie Sherman. Cast also includes Michele Lee (as Lou’s wife), Robert Reed, Donald Hotton, Harry Solin.
